Research

Peer-reviewed articles & book chapters

  • Scarazzato, L., Liang, X., Tian, N., & Lopes da Silva, D. (2024). Developments in Arms Production and the Effects of the War in Ukraine. Defence and Peace Economics, 1–21.
  • Silva, D. L. (2023). Political Accountability and Military Spending. Defence and Peace Economics, 34(5), 563–580.
  • Tian, N., Silva, D. L., Béraud-Sudreau, L., Scarazzato, L., Liang, X., & Assis, A. (2023). Developments in Military Expenditure and the Effects of the War in Ukraine. Defence and Peace Economics, 34(5), 547–562.
  • Silva, D. L. (2020). Arms for export? A reappraisal of the Brazilian arms industry. Economics of Peace and Security Journal, 15(1), 31-38.
  • Tian, N., Lopes da Silva, D., & Kuimova, A. (2020). Military Spending and the Achievement of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. In UNODA Occasional Papers no. 35: Rethinking Unconstrained Military Spending (pp. 21–37). United Nations, New York.
  • Silva, D. L. (2019). Reassessing Brazil’s Arms Industry. In K. Hartley & J. Belin (Eds.), The Economics of the Global Defence Industry. New York: Routledge.
  • Silva, D. L. (2018). Filling arms production data gaps: South America as a case in point. Economics of Peace and Security Journal, 13(2), 20–27.
